dialogue_history.content:
Analyze this financial news and estimate stock price movement probabilities.
Company: Apple Inc. (AAPL)
News Headline: TikTok says 'in the process of restoring service' after going dark in US, citing Trump 'clarity'
News Content: TikTok said Sunday afternoon it was in the process of restoring service to its US users after going dark overnight when a new law banning the app took effect at midnight.

In a post on X Sunday afternoon, TikTok said, "In agreement with our service providers, TikTok is in the process of restoring service. We thank President Trump for providing the necessary clarity and assurance to our service providers that they will face no penalties providing TikTok to over 170 million Americans and allowing over 7 million small businesses to thrive."

In a social media post on Sunday, Trump asked tech companies to "not let TikTok stay dark" and reiterated his plan to issue a reprieve once he takes office.

"I will issue an executive order on Monday to extend the period of time before the law’s prohibitions take effect, so that we can make a deal to protect our national security,” Trump posted. “The order will also confirm that there will be no liability for any company that helped keep TikTok from going dark before my order."

TikTok's statement followed roughly two hours later.

Beginning late Saturday, US TikTok users were shown a message saying the app wasn't available, citing the new law.

The alert also mentioned Trump by name saying, "We are fortunate that President Trump has indicated that he will work with us on a solution to reinstate TikTok once he takes office."

On its website, TikTok told users they could still login to download their data. As of Sunday afternoon, that message had been updated to read: "We're working hard to resolve this issue. Thank you for your patience."TikTok went dark Saturday night, just ahead of a ban on Sunday. (Source: Yahoo Finance/Dan Howley)·Howley

Still, many on Capitol Hill — not to mention outside experts — questioned whether Trump will have the authority to make good on these promises.

Some of Trump’s closest political allies are also the most outspoken critics of TikTok, and have so far stood by the law that they passed last April with strong bipartisan margins.

In a statement early Sunday, Republican Sens. Tom Cotton and Pete Ricketts said, "now that the law has taken effect, there’s no legal basis for any kind of 'extension' of its effective date." Cotton added earlier this week on the Senate floor that "there will be no extension, no concession, and no compromises for TikTok."

Story Continues

House Speaker Mike Johnson, another top Trump ally, also raised questions Sunday, telling NBC he wanted to see the current law enforced and that he is "really heartened to see that Google and Apple and Microsoft have taken the steps to comply with the law."

The back-and-forth between Trump, TikTok, and US lawmakers will remain in acute relief on Monday, with TikTok CEO Shou Zi Chew expected to be in attendance at inauguration events.

Rolling shutdown

Access to TikTok began getting cut off for some US users about 90 minutes before the new law took effect late Saturday. The app was also unavailable via Apple's App Store in the hours leading up to midnight. Videos intermittently loaded on TikTok for a time, but the app also showed a blacked-out screen indicating network issues.

Saturday night's rolling cutoff for US TikTok users followed a report from The Information which said Oracle (ORCL), which manages TikTok's US servers, was set to begin shutting down servers that host TikTok's data as early as 9:00 p.m. ET.

The law that has resulted in TikTok's shutdown doesn't outright ban the app, but rather it prohibits users from accessing the platform through app stores, like those run by Apple (AAPL) and Google (GOOG, GOOGL), and cloud services unless parent company ByteDance sells itself to an owner that is not controlled by a country the US considers adversarial.

Congress has accused ByteDance of having close ties to the Chinese government and alleges that the Chinese Communist Party could force the company to provide it with information on US users or otherwise spread propaganda on the platform.

But the outcry from users and TikTok's backers forced President Joe Biden and Trump to respond. Even with Trump's assurances Apple and Google that his administration won't enforce the law, it's not guaranteed that his — or any other administration — would do so in the future. Each time the companies don't comply with the law they'd have to pay a fine of $5,000 each time a user accesses the social media app.

Trump will have to either convince Congress to overturn the ban or find some other way to work around it if he wants to keep the service up and running, and neither of those is simple.

'It's a good thing for Meta'

Should TikTok's ban eventually come to pass, one of the biggest winners could be one of TikTok’s long-term critics: Meta (META) CEO Mark Zuckerberg. In particular, Instagram, owned by Meta, could see a sizable uptick in advertiser dollars if TikTok bites the dust.

“In general, it’s a good thing for Meta,” William Blair research analyst Ralph Schackart told Yahoo Finance. “We estimate in a note potentially 60% to 70% of TikTok spend could move to Instagram and it monetizes at around 3x the rate of TikTok.”

Social media companies have been chasing TikTok’s formula in an attempt to copy the social media platform’s success for some time. Reddit (RDDT), for example, offers its own short-form video feed that could entice former TikTok users looking for a broader kind of social media site complete with various message boards and communities.

Snapchat (SNAP) could also grab users who would have otherwise spent time on TikTok — and the advertising dollars that follow. But as Morgan Stanley managing director Brian Nowak points out, Snap would have to ensure it can keep those TikTok refugees coming back over and over again — as TikTok does — if it hopes to hold onto that ad revenue.

Pinterest (PINS) also stands to get a boost if TikTok is forced to go dark. While the app doesn’t have much in common with TikTok as far as overall design, it could offer an opportunity for online retailers looking to drum up e-commerce sales, something TikTok has managed to do thanks to its army of influencers.Sign up for Yahoo Finance's Week in Tech newsletter.·yahoofinance

With additional reporting from Ben Werschkul.

Alexis Keenan is a legal reporter for Yahoo Finance. Follow Alexis on X @alexiskweed.

Email Daniel Howley at dhowley@yahoofinance.com. Follow him on Twitter at @DanielHowley.

Next I will provide you some predictions of stock price movement probabilities and the corresponding analysis by others in the previous rounds.
Note that others' predictions may indicate that they have some other information about the stock price. A high prediction may indicate that they have some positive information about the stock, while a low prediction may indicate that they have some megative information about the stock.
Also note that there are multiple rounds of precitions, demonstrating the trend of others' beliefs.
Please take these information into consideration when prediction the stock price movement probabilities.
Previous predictions:
Round: 0
Model: openai/gpt-4o-mini, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.75, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.25, Reasoning: The news highlights Apple Inc.'s inclusion in Louis Navellier's top long-term stock picks, which suggests a positive outlook from a respected investor known for identifying high-growth stocks. The company's strong financial performance, including a year-over-year revenue increase and advancements in AI technology, further supports a bullish sentiment. Additionally, the focus on sustainability and environmental responsibility may attract socially conscious investors. However, the article also mentions that there are stocks with potentially higher returns, which could temper enthusiasm for AAPL. Overall, the positive aspects outweigh the negatives, leading to a higher probability of stock price rise.
Model: google/gemini-2.0-flash-001, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.65, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.35, Reasoning: The news article focuses on the 'Magnificent Seven' stocks, including Apple, and their dividend yields and capital growth potential. While the article highlights that the dividend yields are relatively low, it emphasizes the significant capital appreciation potential driven by AI and other technological advancements. For Apple specifically, the article mentions the launch of Apple Intelligence and its potential to drive software revenue and device upgrades. This positive outlook on Apple's future growth prospects, coupled with the overall positive sentiment surrounding the 'Magnificent Seven,' suggests a higher probability of the stock price rising. However, the article also mentions that the Motley Fool analysts identified other stocks that could produce monster returns, which could slightly dampen the enthusiasm for Apple. Considering these factors, I estimate a higher probability of a stock price rise than a fall.
Model: google/gemini-flash-1.5, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.35, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.35, Reasoning: The news article discusses the temporary shutdown and subsequent restoration of TikTok in the US due to a new law.  While the initial shutdown might have seemed positive for Apple (as it removed a competitor from the App Store), the subsequent restoration, driven by Trump's intervention, negates this positive impact.  The uncertainty surrounding the future of TikTok in the US, coupled with the legal challenges and political infighting, creates a neutral to slightly negative outlook for Apple.  Apple's direct involvement is limited to hosting TikTok on its App Store; the potential for fines if they don't comply with the law is a risk, but Trump's statement offering protection reduces this risk significantly.  The overall impact on Apple's stock price from this news is likely minimal.  The potential benefit to Meta (Facebook) from a permanent TikTok ban is mentioned, but this is not directly relevant to Apple's stock price movement. Therefore, the probabilities are weighted towards a neutral outcome.
Model: deepseek/deepseek-chat-v3-0324, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.45, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.55, Reasoning: The news article primarily discusses Jim Cramer's comments on Apple Inc. (AAPL) in the context of broader market and economic issues, including California wildfires, interest rates, and Mark Zuckerberg's critical remarks about Apple's innovation post-Steve Jobs. While Zuckerberg's comments could be seen as negative for Apple's reputation, the article does not provide concrete evidence of immediate financial or operational impact on Apple. Cramer's reaction to Zuckerberg's remarks was mixed, but he did not suggest any fundamental changes in Apple's business outlook. Given Apple's strong market position and the lack of direct negative financial implications from the news, the stock price is unlikely to be significantly affected. However, the slight negative sentiment from Zuckerberg's comments might introduce minor downward pressure.
Model: meta-llama/llama-4-scout, Prediction of stock price rising: -1, Prediction of stock price falling: -1, Reasoning: Fail to give a prediction. Error Reason: Parse error
Model: meta-llama/llama-3.3-70b-instruct, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.45, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.35, Reasoning: The news article highlights that Apple Inc. is heavily dominated by institutional owners, with 61% of the shares owned by institutions. This indicates that the stock price may be vulnerable to the trading decisions of these institutional owners. However, it also suggests that the company is well-regarded by analysts and institutional investors, which could be a positive factor for the stock price. Additionally, the article mentions that the top 25 shareholders collectively own less than 50% of the share register, implying that no single individual has a majority interest. Considering these factors, the news is relatively neutral and does not provide a strong indication of a significant stock price movement in either direction.
Model: qwen/qwen-turbo, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.1, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.1, Reasoning: The provided news headline 'Latest & Upcoming IPOs to Watch in 2025' does not directly relate to Apple Inc. (AAPL). The news is more focused on upcoming IPOs rather than providing any specific information or impact on Apple. Without direct correlation, it's unlikely that this news would have a significant immediate effect on Apple's stock price.
Round: 1
Model: openai/gpt-4o-mini, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.7, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.3, Reasoning: The news highlights Apple Inc.'s inclusion in Louis Navellier's top long-term stock picks, which suggests a positive outlook from a respected investor known for identifying high-growth stocks. The company's strong financial performance, including a year-over-year revenue increase and advancements in AI technology, further supports a bullish sentiment. Additionally, Apple's commitment to sustainability and environmental responsibility may attract socially conscious investors. While the article mentions that there are stocks with potentially higher returns, the overall positive aspects of Apple's performance and strategic initiatives lead to a higher probability of stock price rise compared to fall.
Model: google/gemini-2.0-flash-001, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.7, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.3, Reasoning: The news article discusses the 'Magnificent Seven' stocks, including Apple, and their dividend yields and capital growth potential. While the dividend yields are relatively low, the article emphasizes the significant capital appreciation potential driven by AI and other technological advancements. For Apple specifically, the article mentions the launch of Apple Intelligence and its potential to drive software revenue and device upgrades. This positive outlook on Apple's future growth prospects, coupled with the overall positive sentiment surrounding the 'Magnificent Seven,' suggests a higher probability of the stock price rising. The previous round predictions also show a generally positive sentiment towards Apple. Therefore, I estimate a higher probability of a stock price rise than a fall.
Model: google/gemini-flash-1.5, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.45, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.45, Reasoning: The news focuses on the temporary shutdown and subsequent restoration of TikTok in the US.  While the initial shutdown could have been seen as potentially beneficial to Apple (reduced competition in the App Store), the swift restoration, largely due to Trump's intervention, negates this positive impact. The situation remains highly uncertain.  The legal challenges and political infighting surrounding TikTok's future in the US create a neutral to slightly negative outlook for Apple. Apple's direct involvement is limited to hosting TikTok on its App Store; the potential for fines is mitigated by Trump's statement offering protection, but this protection is not legally guaranteed.  The overall impact on Apple's stock price from this news is likely minimal.  The potential benefit to Meta from a permanent TikTok ban is irrelevant to Apple's stock price movement.  Considering the previous predictions, which range from a strong belief in a price rise to a neutral outlook, and the overall uncertainty of the situation, a neutral probability is most appropriate.  The lack of direct impact on Apple's core business makes a significant price movement unlikely.
Model: deepseek/deepseek-chat-v3-0324, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.4, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.6, Reasoning: The news article discusses Jim Cramer's comments on Apple Inc. (AAPL), focusing on Mark Zuckerberg's critical remarks about Apple's innovation post-Steve Jobs and broader market issues like California wildfires and interest rates. While Zuckerberg's comments could be seen as negative for Apple's reputation, the article does not provide concrete evidence of immediate financial or operational impact on Apple. Cramer's reaction to Zuckerberg's remarks was mixed, but he did not suggest any fundamental changes in Apple's business outlook. Given Apple's strong market position and the lack of direct negative financial implications from the news, the stock price is unlikely to be significantly affected. However, the slight negative sentiment from Zuckerberg's comments might introduce minor downward pressure. Previous predictions from other models also reflect a neutral to slightly negative outlook, with probabilities ranging from 0.35 to 0.55 for a fall. Considering these factors, the probability of a stock price rise is slightly lower than the probability of a fall.
Model: meta-llama/llama-4-scout, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.55, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.45, Reasoning: The provided news article does not directly mention Apple Inc. (AAPL) or any specific information that could impact its stock price. The article discusses the Nasdaq Composite Index, which is a stock market index that includes Apple but also many other companies. Without direct reference to Apple's performance, financials, or specific news that could influence its stock price, the impact of this news on Apple's stock is likely to be minimal. Given that there is no specific information about Apple in the news headline or content, and considering the general nature of the news about the Nasdaq Composite Index, it is reasonable to assume a neutral stance with a slight inclination towards a positive outlook due to the overall market trends and Apple's inclusion in the index. However, since the news does not provide any direct insights into Apple's performance or future prospects, the probabilities should reflect a cautious or neutral perspective.
Model: meta-llama/llama-3.3-70b-instruct, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.55, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.45, Reasoning: The news article highlights that Apple Inc. is heavily dominated by institutional owners, with 61% of the shares owned by institutions. This indicates that the stock price may be vulnerable to the trading decisions of these institutional owners. However, it also suggests that the company is well-regarded by analysts and institutional investors, which could be a positive factor for the stock price. Additionally, the article mentions that the top 25 shareholders collectively own less than 50% of the share register, implying that no single individual has a majority interest. Considering these factors, the news is relatively neutral and does not provide a strong indication of a significant stock price movement in either direction. The previous predictions from other models show a range of opinions, but most of them are neutral or slightly positive. Therefore, I estimate a slightly higher probability of the stock price rising than falling.
Model: qwen/qwen-turbo, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.1, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.1, Reasoning: The provided news headline 'Latest & Upcoming IPOs to Watch in 2025' does not directly relate to Apple Inc. (AAPL). The content of the article focuses on upcoming IPOs, which does not offer any specific information or impacts on Apple. While previous predictions show varied sentiments, the current news does not provide a basis for predicting a significant stock price movement for Apple. The lack of direct correlation suggests that the news is unlikely to have a substantial immediate effect on Apple’s stock price.
Round: 2
Model: openai/gpt-4o-mini, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.7, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.3, Reasoning: The news highlights Apple Inc.'s inclusion in Louis Navellier's top long-term stock picks, which suggests a positive outlook from a respected investor known for identifying high-growth stocks. The company's strong financial performance, including a year-over-year revenue increase and advancements in AI technology, further supports a bullish sentiment. Additionally, Apple's commitment to sustainability and environmental responsibility may attract socially conscious investors. While the article mentions that there are stocks with potentially higher returns, the overall positive aspects of Apple's performance and strategic initiatives lead to a higher probability of stock price rise compared to fall.
Model: google/gemini-2.0-flash-001, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.75, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.25, Reasoning: The news focuses on the 'Magnificent Seven' stocks, including Apple, and their role in driving market growth and returning capital to shareholders. While the dividend yield is modest, the article highlights the potential for capital appreciation driven by AI, particularly Apple Intelligence. Apple's large user base and potential for software revenue growth are positive factors. The article also mentions stock buybacks as a way to return capital, which is a positive signal. Considering the overall positive sentiment towards the 'Magnificent Seven' and Apple's specific AI initiatives, the probability of a stock price rise is higher. The previous rounds also show a generally positive sentiment towards Apple, which further supports this prediction.
Model: google/gemini-flash-1.5, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.45, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.45, Reasoning: The news focuses on the temporary shutdown and subsequent restoration of TikTok in the US.  The initial shutdown might have offered a slight competitive advantage to Apple, but the quick restoration, largely due to Trump's intervention, negates this. The situation remains highly uncertain, with ongoing legal challenges and political infighting. Apple's direct involvement is limited to hosting TikTok on its App Store; the potential for fines is mitigated by Trump's statement, but this isn't legally guaranteed.  The overall impact on Apple's stock price from this news is likely minimal. The potential benefit to Meta from a permanent TikTok ban is irrelevant to Apple. Considering the previous predictions, which range from a strong belief in a price rise to a neutral outlook, and the overall uncertainty, a neutral probability is most appropriate. (AAPL), focusing on Mark Zuckerberg's critical remarks about Apple's innovation post-Steve Jobs and broader market issues like California wildfires and interest rates. While Zuckerberg's comments could be seen as negative for Apple's reputation, the article does not provide concrete evidence of immediate financial or operational impact on Apple. Given Apple's strong market position and the lack of direct negative financial implications from the news, the stock price is unlikely to be significantly affected. Considering these factors, the probability of a stock price rise is slightly lower than the probability of a fall.

Now give your prediction about the probability of the stock price of the relevant company rising or falling. Format your response in JSON format and include the following information as follows: 
{ 
"reasoning": "[Summarize your analysis and reasoning process here]", 
"company_name": "[Company Name indicating the name of the company]", 
"company_symbol": "[Company Symbol indicating the stock symbol of the company]", 
"news_headline": "[News Headline indicating the provided financial news headline]", 
"probability_of_stock_price_rise": [The estimated probability (a number between 0 and 1) that the stock price will rise due to this news], 
"probability_of_stock_price_fall": [The estimated probability (a number between 0 and 1) that the stock price will fall due to this news], 
} 
Do not generate output that isn't in properly formatted JSON.

```json
{
  "reasoning": "The news about TikTok's temporary shutdown and subsequent restoration has a very limited direct impact on Apple.  While a prolonged TikTok ban might have benefited Apple by reducing competition and potentially increasing App Store revenue, the swift resolution negates this.  Trump's intervention, while offering protection from fines for Apple and Google, is not legally binding and introduces uncertainty. The political infighting surrounding the issue further adds to the uncertainty.  The previous predictions show a wide range of opinions, reflecting the lack of a clear, direct impact on Apple's stock price.  Considering the minimal direct relevance and the high uncertainty, the most likely outcome is minimal price movement.  Therefore, the probabilities are weighted towards a neutral outcome.",
  "company_name": "Apple Inc.",
  "company_symbol": "AAPL",
  "news_headline": "TikTok says 'in the process of restoring service' after going dark in US, citing Trump 'clarity'",
  "probability_of_stock_price_rise": 0.45,
  "probability_of_stock_price_fall": 0.45
}
```
